headline: The Best Mashed Potatoes
description: This best mashed potato recipe uses fresh garlic mashed into Yukon Gold potatoes with cream cheese, Parmesan, butter, and chives for a bold side dish.

video.description: See how to make fluffy mashed potatoes that are, well, the best!
video.name: The Best Mashed Potatoes

name: The Best Mashed Potatoes
recipeIngredient: 0.5 medium head garlic, peeled and minced
1 pinch salt and pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Peel and quarter potatoes; place in a large pot. Cover with salted water and bring to a boil. Cook until tender but still firm, about 15 minutes.
Drain and return potatoes to the pot over low heat to dry for 1 to 2 minutes.
Add Parmesan cheese, cream cheese, chives, butter, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Use a potato masher to mash until smooth and serve.

review.reviewBody: This recipe is okay. I used some light cream to keep them moist. Also, I only use roasted garlic in my mashed potatoes. The garlic flavor comes through, but without the bite of raw garlic
Omg YUMMY!!!

You guys my mash potatoes were amazing and with soufflÃ© omelette i can't resist ðŸ¤¤ Recipe for soufflÃ© omelette *2 eggs * 1 green onions * pinch of salt and pepper whip your eggs first then add 1 green onion pinch of salt and pepper fold with spatula (Side note be careful to not break the air bubble) then fry til gold and Bon appÃ©tit! ðŸ’•ðŸŽŠðŸ¤¤
Swapped the cream cheese for sour cream. Turned out amazing!
Meh. They were flavorful, but pretty dry. I will add butter when I reheat them. Thanks!
This was so good. I donâ€™t like raw garlic added into dishes I think it throws the texture off so I cooked the garlic in a tablespoon of oil until lightly browned before adding it to the potatoes.
Sooo good it was plenty and easy
Was great but was way to thick needed to add milk
These mashed potatoes are so easy to make. They always come out very flavorful and creamy, and is my go-to recipe because it never fails.
These were VERY good mashed potatoes.
Great flavor if you are looking for something different. Just not what I look for in mashed potatoes.

I followed the adjustments from the most helpful review except I used two sticks of butter with the 7 potatoes and I still added the chives but not a full cup. I used a 0.75 oz package and that was plenty. A full cup would probably make it seem like I was eating lawn clippings. After adding the salt and pepper, the mashed potatoes turned out great! Next time, I'll add the cream cheese just to see what kinda flavor it gives.
Great a little more salt is needed but overall it was the best i have ever had

I added my own stuff to it, but these are the BEST mashed potatoes you'll ever eat.
I didn't have cream cheese and only a little bit of Parmesan, so here's what I added:

- a little Parmesan 
-mayo (to replace cream cheese)
-a good amount of Trader Joe's Everything but the Elote seasoning
-rosemary
-any cheese (I had a Mexican Blend laying around)

I eyeballed all the amounts and I kept everything else the same. MUST TRY!!
It was ok but it took me a lot longer to do it.
Perfection!

This recipe has potential, but does not work as written. I would agree with other reviewers that the amount of parmesan cheese is to much and dries out the recipe. Add milk or reduce the amount of parmesan. This is definitely a adjust to taste type of recipe.
very nice, but needed more cheese

I made a 1/5th of this for my husband and I and we both looved them...i boiled the potatoes in the microwave and used cream cheese/greek yogurt blend and Chobani sour cream/greek yogurt blend (and black truffle salt) for a healthier side dish.
The name doesn't lie! This is probably the best mashed potato recipe I've found in years. Made it as written except I halved the recipe. This is a keeper, thanks for sharing!
This went over great at Xmas dinner 2019. I did this recipe instead of my normal recipe. Everton loved my normal recipe at thanksgiving but I shook things up for Xmas and it was ver well received.
Next time I would add some cream and some extra garlic. Otherwise these were delicious!
great flavor! everybody loved it!
Easy and delicious! I will definitely make these potatoes again!
Yum. Lots of stuff added!! I cut down to 1/2 cup Parmesan, 1 cup of cream cheese and butter as directed and there was plenty of flavor! Perfect. I used the cup of chives, garlic, salt and pepper
Good recipe. I didn't make any changes. Liked but didn't love it.
The best mashed potatoes recipe Iâ€™ve been making for years! Easy to follow and tastes amazing every time!
As-is, it was very dry. I added 1.5 C of hot whole milk & it turned out perfect! So many compliments!
Very flavorful! Easy to make!
Can't beat homemade mashed potatoes. This is a great mix of ingredients but I will mention that I added milk to make the mashed potatoes nice & creamy. Mmm mmm good. :)
Less garlic and 1 cup Parmesan cheese. Other than that the recipe is good.
Loved this recipe. Used sea salt and cracked pepper instead. Yum!
Expect to use more time than it says.
My husband and my family devoured these mashed potatos!

This version is very good but it's really hard to go wrong with any mashed potatoe recipe, unless you're stingy with butter. I didn't have any cream cheese so I used the equivalent amount of Mascarpone when making mine for just two people. What I really liked in this dish was the parmesan. This was excellent with buttered green beans and a small filet mignon and red wine and more wine! :-)
I added some whipping cream (1/2 cup) and only used one cup of cream cheese. Amazing!
Good flavor but too dry. Would definitely add milk next time I make it.
I made this with some homegrown new potatoes, and it was fantastic! Super simple and delicious.
Very rich and tasty and easy to make.
My kids' favorite!
My entire family truly enjoyed eating this dish and everyone rated it a "5." I will definitely make this dish again and again as this was mighty tasty and we cannot say enough about this dish.
I have been eating mashed potatoes my entire life - and this is the best I have ever had. No joke. This is my go-to recipe now.
Devine!
OMG. .
BEYOND AMAIZNG!!! Seriously, these mashed potatoes where like going to a gourmet restaurant. Making them again for Christmas dinner...would be great with grilled salmon in the summer too.
Loved these potatoes! A definate keeper.
Made this yesterday for my family. Was told it was the best mashed potatoes they have all ever had. Will definitely be using the recipe a lot. Thank you.
These potatoes were great. turned out a little dry so I will have to add more butter next time...
After reading several reviews, I omitted the cream cheese and these potatoes were terrific.
I loved this. A tiny bland in my opinion but I tend to over-critique my cooking. Everyone thought these potatoes were a hit.
Everyone at the table has never had Mashed potatoes with Cream Cheese. And they all loved it. Mom thought i had used too much Parmesan cheese. Boy was she taken back when they came out amazing.
It was great everyone loved it.
I made half what the original recipe entailed and it came out amazing!!
Yum .... I keep them warm in my crock pot .....

Way too strong on the garlic. Overpowered everything else on the plate. Also, not adding milk made these gluey when mashing and then they solidified and became one solid hard mass in the serving dish. Still edible, but I won't make these again.

Made these following the recipe exactly... Not sure why I thought they were not as good as the other reviewers, but my family thought they tasted like "good instant potatoes" and that wasn't a real compliment. The potatoes were pasty and the parm cheese was overpowering, way too much. Won't make these again.
I could never make mashed potatoes that taste good! I thank you for sharing your recipe,it turned out amazing !
I loved it , my family loved it and it tasted great, no changes were made and I will be making it again.
Cooked the potatoes in the oven after mixing everything together. Added a little milk. Great recipe.

These are REALLY Good! So good they almost need to stand alone as it is ashamed to cover them with gravy or other food. But that's why we make mashed potatoes...right? I was a little skeptical as I had never made mashed potatoes without milk before. And I'm sure the calorie count is much higher on these. But worth it for those special occasions.
I added a little red wine vinegar and Philadelphia whipped cream cheese and chives sour cream

I was recently diagnosed with Ulcerative Colitis and mashed potatoes have become a staple. When I tried these, I heard angels sing! These are the best. I have been making big batches and eating on demand. Man are these awesome!
Fantastic! Easy the only way to make mashed potatoes for a crowd!
OMG!!!! Followed recipe. My husband loved them. Canâ€™t wait for next family gathering. This will be a hit!!!
Alesiaz -- read the recipe again - it clearly says 5 pounds of potatoes .
Really yummy. Nice variation on the theme. Try it with smoked Gouda and dill weed for another nice variation. Remember; leftovers can be 'born again' as gnocchi, pirogi stuffing or loksha . Enjoy!
These are not "mashed potatoes" These are extra cheesy potatoes... I would never make these.
2 cups of Parmesan was a bit much. But other than that, delicious.
Made exactly according to recipe. These were very heavy, thick and sticky. We could not taste the parmesan or the garlic. Will not be making these again.

I really liked this recipe. I did not follow directions but it definitely gave me inspiration. I just boiled some potatoes, added a stick of butter, some milk, garlic powder instead of fresh garlic, salt, pepper, and lots of parmesan came out great and buttery.
Sooooo easy and SOOOO GOOD! I boiled the potatoes for 30 minutes and they mashed perfectly. The combined ingredients made them so creamy, and we didn't even need to add salt!!
i changed one thing and roasted a whole head of garlic then squeezed it into the potatoes when it was nice and soft. best taters ever!!!
Potatoes were a hit on Thanksgiving! I just added skim milk to help with the consistency.
Loved it and such a quick recipe!

Great Recipe! Made a few changes. First of all raw garlic didn't appeal to me so i sauteed it first in some butter. The aroma is heavenly and i did cut down on the amount of parmesan and cream cheese and then added some milk for creaminess. Skipped the chives and salt and peppered well. Used a hand mixer and combined well ( a little chunky) and transferred to a greased foil pan to be reheated next day for Thanksgiving dinner. Garnished with some finely chopped parsley. Excellent!
My wife said these were the BEST mashed potatoes she has ever eaten !

These are so heavy and sticky, like Playdoh even... or, a cheesy potato brick. The flavor is good, but I felt like I could choke by not fully swallowing, and getting them stuck in my throat. They might make good potato pancakes... I have plenty left over to try!

These are decadent and delicious! My mods: quartered the recipe, and no chives (didn't have any on-hand). I want to try it again and roast the garlic first, there were little crunches, since I didn't mince finely enough, I also might try with half the cream cheese, as they were pretty thick. Otherwise delicious and dangerous, haha.
Followed most reviewers directions and cut down on cream cheese and added milk. They were excellent.

These potatoes were tasty but VERY rich! Like many others members I ended up having to add some milk because they were too thick at first. Next time I think I'll try using half the amount of cheese to see if that helps.

I followed the recipe without changing a thing except making them into individual muffins. I had two problems. First, the cake batter was incredibly thick and had to be thinned out a bit. The other issue was the salt. Next time I would use half the salt listed and unsalted butter. I was happy with how the topping turned out and only having to cook them an extra 5 minutes.
Changes? I use sour creme. You may substitute Romano cheese this gives a more robust flavor. For your left overs form into patties and sear. Great for breakfast.
These were ok as suggested. I thought they were a little heavy. I think sour cream might be better than cream cheese. Might change that next time.
Great taste easy to make. My family loved the dish
Seriously, THE best mashed potatoes!!
3 stars "as is" because it was too dry, as others have noted. Prefer a more creamy texture, so added milk. Did not cut back on any ingredients and like the taste.
Made them for Thanksgiving. Everyone at the table agreed, these are the best mashed potatoes!
It worked out great but make sure you keep.a lot of the boiling water so you can when it gets too thick.
I used Chef John's method but this recipe. It turned out delicious! My coworker said these were the best mashed potatoes she's ever had. They don't even need gravy they're so good.
Made this for Thanksgiving dinner and everyone loved it! I did use only 1 c parmeson and 1 eight oz package of cream cheese and it was still very flavorful.
So good. I only had dried chives on hand but it still turned out excellently. I'll definitely be making these again!
Thanksgiving for 30 people 10lbs potatoes everyone loved them!
Excellent flavor, I seasoned to taste. Great base recipe.
Rich and tasty! The whole family loved them. Thanks for sharing the recipe
Sarah Jo down there ALWAYS alters the recipes and I tried her way a few times and turned out horrible. Don't listen to her.

This was my first time using cream cheese in mashed potatoes. That combined with the Parmesan cheese was just too much! The dish was way too dense. As soon as the mashed potatoes cooled even slightly, they turned into a solid thick mass. It just boils down to me liking a bit more thinner and creamier mashed potatoes. I would not make this particular recipe again.
I've made this recipe many times; It's becoming famous among friends, family, and colleagues. It's super easy to make and delicious!!!

Since other reviewers commented on the cheesiness, I reduced the parmesan by half, and used sour cream and milk instead. I heated the combined mixture in a saucepan, based on recommendations. While the result was tasty, it was also very rich and so it cannot be eaten in large heapings. Also, I took the butter and garlic, used it to sautee onions, and mixed the drippings into the potatoes, and then served the onions on the side. Overall, it came out pretty well.

With some modifications, this recipe was pretty good. If your family is fairly conservative and likes tradition, you will want to modify this so it isn't so shocking. My modifications came about once I first tasted them even after already cutting the parmesan cheese and cream cheese in half. I would definitely recommend cutting back on both of those cheeses, adding sour cream and whole milk. Otherwise, these potatoes have too strong of a cheese flavor and are way too thick if milk is not used. I also added extra butter.
